result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Nichols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders defendant to re-pay the costs for Court Appointed Counsel - $889.00 - PAID.  Court orders the money on file be applied first to the attorney fees and then to the court costs.

-AODA assessment and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court has no objection to electronic monitoring, out of county service and out of county travel.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:06 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - will proceed with sentencing.  Atty Wilsnack has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

CONDITIONS:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-60 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court has no objection to electronic monitoring, out of county service and out of county travel.
-AODA assessment and any follow-up
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Court costs.
-Re-payment of court appointed attorney fees.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:15 a.m.
to counsel with a copy of the presentence investigation report.
Sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Settlement Form (PTC)

2:41 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge and defendant requests a PSI.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and strikes the repeater and place enhancer.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a Pre-Sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court within 60 days.  Court will contact counsel for Sentencing date.  

Court adjourned at 2:47 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

10:16 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - has received an offer from the DA's office and requests to discuss further with the DA.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing.

Court adjourned at 10:17 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 10:00 am

10:08 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - have received some final Discovery from the DA's office on friday.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on April 5, 2016 at 10:00 a.m

Court adjourned at 10:10 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:16 p.m.
Status hearing at 01-12-2016 02:00 pm

8:49 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - no prelim or waiver has been held.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Wilsnack and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Wilsnack enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 12, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 8:51 p.m.

Statement by defendant - will be getting an attorney, does not qualify for PD representation and requests court appointed counsel.  Court questions defendant regarding payment towards counsel.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders defendant to pay $300 per month commencing September 15, 2015 and each month thereafter.  Court will appoint counsel.
